thread.title: The Ghazi Attack box office collection day 8: Rana Daggubati and Taapsee Pannu’s film earns Rs 29.65 crore
thread.title_full: The Ghazi Attack box office collection day 8: Rana Daggubati and Taapsee Pannu’s film earns Rs 29.65 crore

author: Karan Shah
title: The Ghazi Attack box office collection day 8: Rana Daggubati and Taapsee Pannu’s film earns Rs 29.65 crore
text:
Why Shahid Kapoor and Saif Ali Khan ditched Rangoon's special screening - read details 
Rana Daggubati and Taapsee Pannu ‘s The Ghazi Attack released on February 17 and looks like it is performing decently at the box office. The film, which was simultaneously released in Hindi, Telugu and Tamil, has raked in Rs a decent collection of Rs 29.65 crore in 8 days through all the three versions. While many will argue that it should have made more money, let us inform you that considering the size of release, The Ghazi Attack has performed decently. However, we expected it to do better in the Hindi Version, where it could collect only Rs 12.75 crore in 8 days. 
Talking about the detailed collections, trade analyst Taran Adarsh revealed on Twitter, “#TheGhaziAttack [Week 2] Fri 90 lakhs. Total: Rs 12.75 cr. Hindi version… ALL VERSIONS – Week 2: Fri 2.40 cr. Total: Rs 29.65 cr. STEADY!” As Taran mentioned, The Ghazi Attack has been steady even with competition from a film like Akshay Kumar ‘s Jolly LLB 2 . And while the film got mixed reviews, a few people have been raving about the story and the performances of all the lead actors on social media. This has given rise to a small word of mouth publicity, which has helped the movie rake in the moolah. ALSO READ – 5 reasons why Rana Daggubati and Taapsee Pannu’s The Ghazi Attack is a game changer when it comes to Indian cinema 
But with the release of Shahid Kapoor , Saif Ali Khan and Kangana Ranaut’s Rangoon , we expect The Ghazi Attack to see a decline in collection, at least in the Hindi version. Rangoon has taken up 1800 screens, so obviously Rana Daggubati’s film has a smaller screen space in its second week. Its performance over the second weekend will now determine if the film will sustain throughout the next week or not. ALSO READ – After Rana Daggubati and Taapsee Pannu’s The Ghazi Attack, 5 legendary real-life war time stories Bollywood must adapt on screen 
For those of you who don’t know, The Ghazi Attack is based on the mysterious sinking of Pakistani submarine PNS Ghazi during Indo-Pakistan War of 1971. Apart from Rana and Taapsee, Kay Kay Menon and Atul Kulkarni are also a part of the movie. Published: February 25, 2017 7:39 pm Topics:
